text: I'm Ballad of Samaria Mok they are from
Karachi and I'm 21 years old I'm
undergoing training in advanced jet
training squadron PF Academy sir I
decided to join PFF because I was very
much you motivated by the discipline and
the uniform and their poem they were
show plus I always wanted to do
something which was different than
normal routine my mother is sometimes
concerned that it's a male oriented
Society and the job I am doing is very
different very extraordinary so her
concern is were there and I respect her
concern but she also stands by with me
and with my decision and she is happy
for me as well I get up early in the
morning and 5:30 6 o'clock then we just
reached to our squadrons and we take our
breakfast and we rush to our IPS for
briefing the briefers are regarding our
present-day mission and we go for the
aircraft's we strap up go for mission
come back we get debriefs they are
treating the same as two meals at two
ladies but although there is some
difference there are certain physical
limitations I cannot deny that but you
can say that they do deal a similarly
most of the people think that Pakistan
has very restrictions for women but I
want to say that no it's not like that
they should come in Pakistan and see
what the Pakistan is actually doing the
aim of the PF is to train a self so that
we can become the fighter pilots for
Pakistan
I feel really proud of what I am doing I
really feel honored that Air Force has
given me the chance to work with them PF
exchange me in many ways because it has
actually grown to him anyways it has
groomed my personality it has given me
my own identity and a confidence to face
the world I think people would
appreciate what I am doing and they
would also think of their daughters and
sisters to be where and where I am today
